alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 8:00AM EDT until May 03 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Cumberland, Gloucester, and Salem. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 AM EDT, the stream gauge on the Maurice River at Norma was above flood stage. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the warned area. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - For Maurice River at Norma: At 7:15am the stage was 4.05 feet. Flood Stage is 4 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
